intro: Lavatera pallescens, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, fluffy white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and adaptability contribute to its appeal in both cultivated and natural landscapes.
